channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: This all sounds amusing, but Maimonides, for one, was empowered by the the Egyptian government back in the day to lead the Jewish community. https://t.co/ry4k4siknn
@trekonomics Who would have imagined that RAH would be the liberal voice out times demand? https://t.co/TY5gwL4zSy
Putting politics — that is, the desires of the powerful — over the health of the public. “the White House asked her to water down guidance to states.” https://t.co/0Mwerywowy
@atrubek Here’s a fun book on a slightly older canon in a slightly different era of publishing. https://t.co/WFfN0Q1cdm

“Judaism’s principle of ‘Lev yodea marat nafsho’ authorizes as experts both pregnant people who want to end a pregnancy and trans people seeking gender-affirming care or the right to live as their true selves. It demands that we honor the self-knowledge of those individuals.” https://t.co/4dKpJuhtiv

@trekonomics Remember: This country gives more political power to people with more land. And the more enslaved humans you brought with you to America back in the day, the more land you got.
@trekonomics Colonial America actively selected for sadism.
The current Catholic-led rogue SCOTUS is a reminder that you don’t need to be a Calvinist to play Calvinball. https://t.co/74eMSS8gXq
Moving ever closer to remaking the early Beatle albums with harmonies by @dick_nixon and the Kennedy Brothers. https://t.co/54FhYdI4wa
@bruces I think we’re pretty close to the point of generating 3D models from a series of overlapping photos of grandma’s heads from all directions.

Your occasional reminder that liberal constitutional orders that enable Jews to be citizens of “Christian” countries are subject to change. https://t.co/tMAVJyGGCH
But while it took 80 years for Vichy to have loud Jewish defenders, the current effort to make America a Christofascist state already has loud Orthodox Jewish defenders.
@rmneiss @LaraFriedmanDC https://t.co/JLF3zuxKZU
Also worth noting that Reason, funded by the Kochs as an ostensibly “libertarian” venue, is now home to right-wing theocrats. https://t.co/bQO63V8FZd
@RokhlK Well, we taught them a lesson in 1945 and they’ve hardly bothered us since then.
@onthemainline @ariella_kay How else are you going to manipulate them, if they’re too good to be manipulated by greed, lust, or envy?
@MisfitTorah Seems like a day well spent. Looking forward. I very much enjoyed your Seforno one.
Another datapoint for the argument that American policing can best be understood as an army of occupation. https://t.co/t8R3qaXbqu

@ZacharyBraiterm Did you leave before or after the dude writing at an ostensibly libertarian outlet began arguing that non-Orthodox Jews aren’t frum enough to merit religious freedoms under the evolving Opus Dei Constitutional order?
@sillyhead It will start with Emergency Rabbinical Holograms. But then it will become routine, bringing even more woe to troubled rabbinical schools.

In which I write up a @GenizaLab post. https://t.co/XGkgwAiXtJ
@GenizaLab Original post here: https://t.co/VgPO6jKu1F
In which I write up a @genizalabs post. https://t.co/XGkgwAiXtJ
@alicesperi @theintercept Where our rights go to die.
@dylanotes @yitzlandes @nytimes @AP @AIPAC Not all Americans believe in journalism, Dylan.

@jonvankin @froomkin Over in NYC, https://t.co/i23kAAcNip seems to be bootstrapping a decent mixture of smart local reporting and smart local features in what is effectively a local news desert with 8 million people.
@froomkin @maggieNYT Funny how she has opinions of what’s in a source’s head, but her colleague Peter Baker has no opinions as to which candidate will be best for the country.

Your reminder that not taking responsibility for one’s inevitable consequences is central to the American legal, economic, and political order. https://t.co/fTfL4T9JJJ
That this is at radical odds with the basic Talmudic principles I learned as a ninth grade yeshiva student explains my ongoing cognitive dissonance.
